title: Next.js
description: React framework for production - SSR, SSG, API routes, routing, and performance optimization

questions.question: What's the difference between SSR and SSG in Next.js?
options: SSR is client-side, SSG is server-side
SSR renders at request time, SSG renders at build time
questions.explanation: SSR (Server-Side Rendering) renders pages on each request, while SSG (Static Site Generation) pre-renders pages at build time.

questions.question: Which function enables SSG with data fetching?
questions.explanation: getStaticProps runs at build time and allows you to fetch data for static generation.

questions.question: How do you create an API route in Next.js?
questions.explanation: API routes are created by adding files to the /pages/api directory. Each file becomes an API endpoint.

questions.question: What does the Image component optimize?
options: Size, format, and loading with lazy loading
questions.explanation: Next.js Image component optimizes images by resizing, changing formats, and implementing lazy loading automatically.

questions.question: What's the purpose of the _app.js file?
questions.explanation: _app.js wraps all page components and is used for global configuration, global CSS, and persistent layouts.
